intro: Nelsonia albicans, commonly known as the white-flowered Nelsonia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, white, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and forested areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Nelsonia albicans is often cultivated for its delicate appearance and ecological value in native habitats.
